summary:
i just watched toy story 4 and the ending is literally almost the same as the ending of endgame
(spoilers ahead)
woody leaving...
body:
i just watched toy story 4 and the ending is literally almost the same as the ending of endgame

(spoilers ahead)

woody leaving his best friend, buzz, to go to bo peep, someone he’s been in love with for years but never got the chance to be with ?

steve leaving his best friend, bucky, to go back to peggy, someone he’s been in love with for years but never got the chance to be with.


woody not seeing bo in years but still in love with her ?

steve not seeing peggy in years but still in love with her.


woody giving his sheriff star to jesse ?

steve giving his shield to sam.

blog.name: aspiestvmusings
blog.title: For the record - I'm proud of you.
blog.description:
BEFORE "FOLLOWING" THIS BLOG & SENDING ASKS, PLEASE FIND A WAY TO READ THROUGH ALL THE INFO, SCROLLING TIL THE END! 
Update: This blog is on permanent TV spoiler talk hiatus! This means I will not reply to most asks, messages, comments. I will post "my thoughts" on spoilery scoop in posts I make, and I have nothing to add, so no need to ask, my thoughts are already posted.    
Blog rule #1: Spoilers are not facts or knowledge. Having access to spoilers does not make anyone better or special. 
Blog rule #2: Facts matter, Feelings don't. 
About: Name: Ann. Female. Aspie. Nerdy. TV fan. Introvert. Atheist. NOT american. Low EQ, high IQ. Very opinionated & "sarcastic". Facts before Feelings. Allergic to people who do not google things & who don't read "FAQ" before asking &  don't have interest in finding answers on their own. 
Blog description:  IS HERE  
I'm not associated with any tv show or network. This is simply a blog run by the most boring tv fangirl...ever. 
I TALK ...A LOT...AND DON'T SAY ANYTHING. If you have a problem with long, babbling text posts, stay far away... I only do long posts & long replies!  
This blog is not designed to be viewed on mobile device (reason: image heavy, long posts) 
This blog is NOT spoiler free. Only official scoop, no "gossip" talk! Spoiler rules/info  @FAQ   &  @SCORPION FANS  & under ASK BOX  Most Qs you have are already answered there! 
Asks about peoples personal lives, unreleased spoilers, spoiler sources, plus Qs answered in my recent posts/info pages or in the tags, or things easy to google DO NOT get replied! Check past posts & tags & google things before sending in a new ask!
I share this POV on anons & their take on blogs (like mine) & bloggers (like me) that post/share TV spoilers & thoughts:  READ THIS  
Made you look! #TeamQuintis

title: AVENGERS: ENDGAME THOUGHT:
body:
SPOILERS BELOW! 

So… Endgame has not yet beaten Avatar in (total) Box Office, but it’s come really close, so they are “re-releasing” the film next week (June 28th?). 

In certain cinemas/To a certain number of screens. 

I’m guessing this will be just in the US. But, hopefully, maybe..also elsewhere. 


Because  while I do think that the extra footage that will be added to the re-release (there will be a little extra material “after the credits” - a deleted scene (which could possibly be the Tony/Morgan meet in Soul Stone scene? or hopefully a bit longer scene for Nat’s memorial/funeral. But possibly something Steve/Cap “time travel” ending related instead, and a few more extra scenes/moments) will be also on the DVD/BluRay, so I’ll see it anyway. 

The extra few minutes (”after credits scenes”) at the end of the re-release could also possibly be a  (longer) Stan Lee cameo or credit. Or the Tony/teen Morgan (deleted) scene. Or Nat’s memorial/funeral. Or just a few alternate takes of soem big scenes. And possibly “??? WILL RETURN”  text at the end…for one of the remaining characters. 

I do plan to go see Endgame once more in theaters on July 1st/2nd or just before that..if I have time & if it’s still showing here then, because I wanna go see Spiderman: FFH with “extra fresh” memories of the previous film. 

It will/would be my 9th viewing of the film in a cinema. 

But I do hope that if they’ll re-release it ONLY in US, thern those who will go see it, share the information about WHAT the extra footage was also with others here/online. Cause I/we most likely will have to wait til the DVD release to see it all ourselves. 


PS. Yes, it is kinda silly that they tend to re-release films in cinemas to get higher overall box office numbers. But this is not the first, and won’t be the last film, to do it. An d I do think the film deserves the #1 spot, so everyone who can, please go and see it. For RDJ and Tony, for the cast who did amazing jb, For the crew who did amazing job (the sets, the costumes, the music, the visuals, the VFX….) And as the final& closing chapter of a 22-film saga…

blog.name: mrdaps
blog.title: Mr. DAPs
blog.description:
Hi there!

I am Mr. DAPs, that guy with the hat that walks around Disneyland. I will mainly be posting some pictures that I have taken that I particularly like here but will occasionally post some other things.

You can read some of my other posts at any or all of the links below:

Blog: mrdaps.com
Website: dapsmagic.com
Twitter: twitter.com/mrdaps
Facebook: facebook.com/misterdaps

Please feel free to add me on any or all of the above links. I look forward to chatting with you and seeing you in the park!

Make it a GREAT day!

-Mr. DAPs

summary: Soarin' Around the Galaxy - DISNEY Reporter
title: Soarin' Around the Galaxy - DISNEY Reporter
body:
Soarin’ Around the Galaxy – DISNEY Reporter

Welcome to another edition of the DISNEY Reporter. This week’s edition has news ranging from the Disneyland and Walt Disney World Resorts, to Toy Story 4, to the newest Pixar film. It also has details about Avengers: Endgame. We hope you enjoy this week’s edition of the DISNEY Reporter. We’ll see you in the parks!

summary: Un omaggio ad Iron Man nel poster della nuova uscita al cinema di Avengers: Endgame
title: Un omaggio ad Iron Man nel poster della nuova uscita al cinema di Avengers: Endgame
body:
Un omaggio ad Iron Man nel poster della nuova uscita al cinema di Avengers: Endgame

Come già riferito in un nostro precedente aggiornamento, Avengers: Endgame tornerà nei cinema americani per una versione che omaggerà i fan Marvel.

In occasione della partenza della nuova “mini” campagna promozionale, i Marvel Studios hanno svelato il poster ufficiale della riedizione. In tutto e per tutto un omaggio ad Iron Man. L’artwork mostra, infatti, il Guanto dell’Infinito creato da Ton…

summary: It's a tough market: Russo Brothers on making indie film 'Cherry'
title: It's a tough market: Russo Brothers on making indie film 'Cherry'
body:
It’s a tough market: Russo Brothers on making indie film ‘Cherry’

Los Angeles:

Director duo Anthony and Joe Russo have back-to-back four Marvel Studios blockbusters to their credit, but the filmmakers believe no matter how much box office success they have attained in recent years, it is always tough to make a indie project.

Following the blockbuster performance of their last venture “Avengers: Endgame”, the directors are now working on indie film “Cherry”,…

View On WordPress

summary: My dad is taking me to watch Endgame with the new footage in a couple of weeks and I'm so excited but I'm not ready at all. I'm...
body: My dad is taking me to watch Endgame with the new footage in a couple of weeks and I’m so excited but I’m not ready at all. I’m practically having a panic attack just thinking about having to watch Nat die, Tony die and Steve grow old again. I’m not ready to cry in the cinema, not again

summary: So, apparently there was a scene after Tony snapped his fingers of him in the "soul gem world" that Thanos went to when he...
body:
So, apparently there was a scene after Tony snapped his fingers of him in the “soul gem world” that Thanos went to when he snapped his fingers in Infinity War and there Tony finds a grown up Morgan (played by Katherine Langford) but it was removed because test audiences were confused.

Thanks, test audiences.

reblog.comment:
So, apparently there was a scene after Tony snapped his fingers of him in the “soul gem world” that Thanos went to when he snapped his fingers in Infinity War and there Tony finds a grown up Morgan (played by Katherine Langford) but it was removed because test audiences were confused.

Thanks, test audiences.

trail.content_raw:
So, apparently there was a scene after Tony snapped his fingers of him in the “soul gem world” that Thanos went to when he snapped his fingers in Infinity War and there Tony finds a grown up Morgan (played by Katherine Langford) but it was removed because test audiences were confused.

Thanks, test audiences.
trail.content:
So, apparently there was a scene after Tony snapped his fingers of him in the “soul gem world” that Thanos went to when he snapped his fingers in Infinity War and there Tony finds a grown up Morgan (played by Katherine Langford) but it was removed because test audiences were confused.

Thanks, test audiences.

summary: 'Avengers: Endgame' set footage shows Robert Downey Jr filming the snap
title: 'Avengers: Endgame' set footage shows Robert Downey Jr filming the snap
body:
WARNING: There are MAJOR SPOILERS ahead for Avengers: Endgame. So if you’re yet to see the mega blockbuster then please don’t read ahead.

The ultimate piece of behind the scenes footage from Avengers: Endgame has dropped online, which shows Robert Downey Jr filming the already iconic snap from its climax.

Kudos to Jimmy Rich, who just so happens to be Robert Downey Jr’s assistant, for uploading the video of the Oscar nominated actor going all in on his line reading of, “I am Iron Man.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by jimmy rich (@jimmy_rich) on Jun 20, 2019 at 10:39pm PDT

Of course, this was in response to Thanos declaring, “I am inevitable,” after he had finally got hold of the Infinity Gauntlet, only for him to discover that Tony Stark had taken all of the Infinity Stones out and put them into his newly made Iron Man Gauntlet.

Read More: It was Robert Downey Jr’s decision to stay silent in Endgame finale

By doing this, though, Stark succumbed to the power of the snap, but did save the galaxy in the process.

Rather surprisingly, this moment was actually the last thing that the Russo Brothers shot during the Endgame reshoots back in January. As the above footage shows, it was completed in a rather intimate setting in Hollywood’s Raleigh Studios rather than Atlanta, where most of the MCU has been filmed.

Read more: Avengers spoiler-ban lifts

“Tony used to not say anything in that moment,” the directors admitted during a post Q&A screening back in DC back in May. “And we were in the editing room going, ‘He has to say something. This a character who has lived and died by quips.’ And we just couldn’t, we tried a million different last lines.”

“Thanos was saying ‘I am inevitable.’ And our editor Jeff Ford, who’s been with us all four movies and is an amazing storyteller, said, ‘Why don’t we just go full circle with it and say, I am Iron Man.’ And we’re like, ‘Get the cameras! We have to shoot this tomorrow.’”

Robert Downey Jr as Iron Man in Avengers: Endgame

WARNING: There are MAJOR SPOILERS ahead for Avengers: Endgame. So if you’re yet to see the mega blockbuster then please don’t read ahead.

The ultimate piece of behind the scenes footage from Avengers: Endgame has dropped online, which shows Robert Downey Jr filming the already iconic snap from its climax.

Kudos to Jimmy Rich, who just so happens to be Robert Downey Jr’s assistant, for uploading the video of the Oscar nominated actor going all in on his line reading of, “I am Iron Man.”

A post shared by jimmy rich (@jimmy_rich) on Jun 20, 2019 at 10:39pm PDT

Of course, this was in response to Thanos declaring, “I am inevitable,” after he had finally got hold of the Infinity Gauntlet, only for him to discover that Tony Stark had taken all of the Infinity Stones out and put them into his newly made Iron Man Gauntlet.

By doing this, though, Stark succumbed to the power of the snap, but did save the galaxy in the process.

Kevin Feige, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Mark Ruffalo and Jeremy Renner Place Their Hand Prints In Cement At TCL Chinese Theatre IMAX Forecourt held at TCL Chinese Theatre IMAX. (Photo by Albert L. Ortega/Getty Images)

Rather surprisingly, this moment was actually the last thing that the Russo Brothers shot during the Endgame reshoots back in January. This a character who has lived and died by quips.’ And we just couldn’t, we tried a million different last lines.”

“Thanos was saying ‘I am inevitable.’ And our editor Jeff Ford, who’s been with us all four movies and is an amazing storyteller, said, ‘Why don’t we just go full circle with it and say, I am Iron Man.’ And we’re like, ‘Get the cameras! We have to shoot this tomorrow.’”
